Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the opening of a Trump Tower hotel in Pyongyang within a day of the historic summit between President Trump and Kim Jong-Un.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there have been no mainstream news reports of the Ryugyong Hotel being rebranded as a Trump property.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or credible sources provided to verify the opening of a Trump Tower hotel in Pyongyang.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Trump Organization declared the new Trump Tower Pyongyang as "the finest mixed-use real-estate venture in the world," but there is no evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the article is a satire and a spoof on the aggrandizing hype surrounding the Trump/Kim summit.
